docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Jan. 5 -- The Nazi organization here has taken advantage of the annual court vacation month of January to renew a desperate legal battle for the release under bond of eight leaders undergoing trial on charges of having plotted to...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Jan. 5 -- The Nazi organization here has taken advantage of the annual court vacation month of January to renew a desperate legal battle for the release under bond of eight leaders undergoing trial on charges of having plotted to seize Uruguay as an agricultural colony for Germany.
docs.abstract: P Barandon works to free Nazis held in Uruguay on charges of plot to seize Uruguay for Germany

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 -- The value of United States exports in November was $16,000,000 lower than the October total, principally because of the decline in shipments of a comparatively few items to Canada, the United Kingdom and Japan, the Department of...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 -- The value of United States exports in November was $16,000,000 lower than the October total, principally because of the decline in shipments of a comparatively few items to Canada, the United Kingdom and Japan, the Department of Commerce made known today.

docs.snippet: A request that prices of velvets for the coming Fall season be adjusted to provide for a discount basis of 8-10 e.o.m. instead of the present terms of 2 per cent, fifteen days, has been sent to velvet producers by the Associated Merchandising...
docs.lead_paragraph: A request that prices of velvets for the coming Fall season be adjusted to provide for a discount basis of 8-10 e.o.m. instead of the present terms of 2 per cent, fifteen days, has been sent to velvet producers by the Associated Merchandising Corporation.

docs.snippet: The United States liner Manhattan is to sail tonight for California via Cuba, Colon and Acapulco. Her passengers include Mrs. R.V. Mullany, Professor and Mrs. William A. Nitze, Mrs. Giles Stedman, Mr. and Mrs. Charles M. Thomson, Mr. and Mrs. Ralph...
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States liner Manhattan is to sail tonight for California via Cuba, Colon and Acapulco. Her passengers include Mrs. R.V. Mullany, Professor and Mrs. William A. Nitze, Mrs. Giles Stedman, Mr. and Mrs. Charles M. Thomson, Mr. and Mrs. Ralph T. Reed, Mr. and Mrs. W.E. Farrell, Mr. and Airs. D.S. Colburn, Mrs. Thomas Meigan, Mrs. Raymond Hitchcock, the Rev. John Brosnan.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Jan. 10 -- Japan is sending a floating exposition of machinery to tour Argentina, Brazil and Uruguay in June in an effort to increase its exports of these products to South America, it was announced by Japanese circles here...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Jan. 10 -- Japan is sending a floating exposition of machinery to tour Argentina, Brazil and Uruguay in June in an effort to increase its exports of these products to South America, it was announced by Japanese circles here today.
docs.abstract: SS Montevideo Maru to be sent to Latin Amer with machinery display; other trade mission touring Latin Amer to arrange barter deals
